content:
• Friday, December 1, 2017

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: XLF +5.2%. UNG +4.5%. VXX +3.8%. XHB +3.3%. XLI +3.1%.
    • Top losers: URA -6.0%. BRF -4.9%. TAN -4.7%. FXI -4.4%. EWZ -4.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SEED

    Origin Agritech CEO Niebur resigns; North American office suspended

    • Origin Agritech (NASDAQ:SEED) -24.3% after-hours on news that William Niebur has resigned as CEO and as a director to pursue other opportunities.
    • The company also says it is suspending its Iowa representative office and will operate its U.S. activities from its headquarters in Beijing, while continuing to seek seed trait and germplasm commercial opportunities in the U.S.
    • Niebur had served as CEO since April 2016 after spending time at DuPont Pioneer as VP and GM with strategic oversight responsibility for China,East Asia and Oceania.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • MEGEF

    MEG Energy sees ~7% higher production in 2018

    • MEG Energy (OTCPK:MEGEF +2.5%) says it expects higher production next year, forecasting 85K-88K bbl/day in 2018 compared to its 2017 forecast of 80K-82K bbl/day, a ~7% improvement at the midpoint of guidance.
    • MEG expects 2018 capex of C$510M (US$396M), most of which is expected to be used to drill new oil wells.
    • MEG plans to spend C$120M on thermal technology at its Christina Lake oil sands project in Alberta, which involves adding gas to steam injected underground to liquefy and extract tarry oil sands bitumen.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • DGX

    Quest completes acquisition of Cleveland HeartLab; formalizes R&D collaboration with Cleveland Clinic; shares up 1%

    • Quest Diagnostics (DGX +0.6%) finalizes its acquisition of Cleveland HeartLab. Concurrently, it has also finalized its R&D collaboration with the Cleveland Clinic aimed at speeding the commercialization of new discoveries there, including the Lerner Research Institute. They intend to collaborate on clinical trials to show the clinical and economic value of these innovations and other biomarkers.
    • Previously: Quest to acquire Cleveland HeartLab (Oct. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool reaffirms 2017 EPS view, issues in-line 2018 guidance

    • Illinois Tool Works (ITW -2.4%) is lower, giving back most of its gains of the previous two days, after reaffirming financial guidance for this year and issuing its 2018 outlook at the company's investor day.
    • ITW reaffirms guidance for FY 2017, seeing GAAP EPS of $6.62-$6.72, in-line with $6.68 analyst consensus estimate, and issues an FY 2018 outlook for GAAP EPS of $7.05-$7.25 vs. $7.20 consensus, as well as 2018 organic revenue growth of 3%-4% and operating margin of 25%-25.5%.
    • Goldman Sachs had predicted that the analyst day would be a bullish catalyst for ITW shares; instead the stock ran higher in the four days leading up to the event, then sold the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • CASI

    CASI Pharma perks up 17% ahead of data presentation on ENMD-2076

    • CASI Pharmaceuticals (CASI +17.3%) is up on more than 50% higher volume on the heels of its announcement of a presentation of Phase 2 data on ENMD-2076 in triple negative breast cancer at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium on December 7.
    • ENMD-2076 is a small molecule multikinase inhibitor with multiple mechanisms of action.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras sees first Libra pre-salt oil shipment in early January

    • Petrobras (PBR +1.7%) says it expects to begin shipping oil in early January from the giant Libra pre-salt area after operations there launched this week with production of ~17.5K bbl/day of oil.
    • Teekay Offshore Partners (TOO +2.1%) says the event marks the start of a 12-year charter contract for the Libra FPSO unit, the first unit to produce oil on the block; the FPSO is owned and operated by TOO and Brazil's Odebrecht through a 50/50 joint venture.
    • PBR owns a 40% in the Libra field, while Total (TOT -0.1%) and Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B) hold 20% each, and China National Petroleum (PTR +0.4%) and Cnooc (CEO +0.1%) each own 10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM

  • Stocks trim losses

    • A bit less than an hour before the close, the major averages have bounced well off of their worst levels of the session. Down more than 1.5% in the immediate aftermath of the Flynn news, the Nasdaq is now lower by 0.7%. The S&P 500 and DJIA are off 0.4%.
    • Working today? Basic material and energy are higher alongside a 1.5% advance for oil.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 25 Comments
  • TEUM

    Pareteum -15.5% after share sales

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM) agreed to sell an aggregate of over7.2M common shares to certain accredited investors at $0.92 per share.
    • The company also agreed to sell the same number of shares in a private placement with an excise price of $1.09 per share with a five-year term. 
    • Pareteum received about $6.58M in gross proceeds from the offering.  
    • In other news, Pareteum underwriter Dawson James Securities exercised an option to purchase an additional 1.4M shares of common stock for $1.2M in additional net proceeds. 
    • Pareteum shares are down 15.5%.     
    • Previously: Pareteum regains listing compliance with NYSE (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • CC

    Facing deadline, Chemours ends all toxic wastewater discharges

    • Chemours (CC -2.6%) agrees to capture all process wastewater, including water tainted with GenX and Nafion, from manufacturing areas that have contaminated the Cape Fear River, North Carolina's Department of Environmental Quality says.
    • The DEQ also says any renewal of the company's pollutant discharge permit would ban all manufacturing wastewater discharge.
    • Earlier this week, a Chemours attorney provided the state with more information about an Oct. 6 spill, after which EPA testing indicated GenX levels at the company's’ outfall on the river had spiked to 3,700 ppt, far above North Carolina’s established health goal of 140 ppt.
    • Following the day's events, Vertical Research suggests buying Tronox (TROX +6.9%) and Venator Materials (VNTR +0.6%).
    • Earlier: Chemours -3% after investor update; North Carolina eyes punishment steps (Dec. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: AMBA +15%. CLRO +13%. NTNX +11%. XNET +11%. NTIP +10%.
    • Losers: TEUM -16%. MTSL -13%. HMNY -12%. PSTG -9%. SPI -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLRO

    ClearOne stakeholder acquires 300K shares

    • ClearOne (NASDAQ:CLRO) 10% owner Edward Bagley acquires 300K additional shares, according to a regulatory filing.
    • Bagley acquired the shares at a price of $7 per share. 
    • ClearOne shares are up 12.8%.  
    • Previously: ClearOne declares $0.07 dividend (Nov. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • HTZ

    Car rental stocks jump on M Science read

    • Hertz Global (HTZ +6.9%) and Avis Budget Group (CAR +4%) are both sharply higher after M Science issues positive data on the car rental stocks.
    • M Science is an analytics firm that has been more active in swinging share prices in the retail sector.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 8 Comments
  • JNPR

    CNBC: Nokia backed away from Juniper after news broke

    • Juniper Networks (NYSE:JNPR) shares popped 22% on Wednesday after a CNBC report that Nokia (NYSE:NOK) would purchase the company at a $16B valuation.
    • Nokia later denied the report 
    • Now CNBC says Nokia backed off the potential merger after the news leaked.
    • CNBC’s sources say Nokia may or may not come back to the talks 
    • Juniper shares are up 2.9%. 
    • Nokia shares are down 1.2%.      
    • Previously: Juniper Networks +22% on report Nokia prepping buyout offer (Nov. 29)
    • Previously: Juniper sheds heavy postmarket gains as Nokia issues deal talk denial (Nov. 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 19 Comments

  • Russia ETF lower after Flynn plea

    • It was earlier reported that former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn testimony will implicate the president and/or senior transition team officials in the Russia probe.
    • The news sent not just U.S. stocks lower, but the ruble and, in turn, the VanEck Vectors Russia ETF (RSX -1.2%). The ruble's decline (about 1% vs. the dollar) is particularly notable given the dollar turned lower against pretty much every other major currency.
    • Previously: Report: Flynn cooperating; stocks head south (Dec. 1)
    • ETFs: RSX, RUSL, RUSS, ERUS, RSXJ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 8 Comments
  • BX

    Bloomberg: Blackstone, Brazilian partner offer $6B for Petrobras pipeline

    • Blackstone (BX -1.4%) has teamed up with a Brazilian partner to bid for Petrobras's (PBR +1.9%) natural gas pipeline network in the country’s northeast, Bloomberg reports.
    • The partners are one of at least three groups that have made non-binding offers of as much as $6B to acquire the asset, according to the report, adding that Mubadala Development and EIG Global Energy Partners have formed a consortium, and a group led by Engie (OTCPK:ENGIY) also is interested.
    • Brazil’s improving economy has prompted more competition for pipelines compared to the $5.2B sale of Nova Transportadoras do Sudeste, a similar pipeline network in the southeast, in 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 6 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: CGG-OLD +15%. MCF +14%. YUMA +14%. CRC +10%. ESV +8%.
    • Losers: YTEN -9%. MFCB -6%. HNRG -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • FB

    Morgan Stanley analyst outlines how Facebook can break even on Watch

    • A Morgan Stanley analyst expects Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) to make $565M in revenue from its Watch feature next year.
    • Analyst Brian Nowak says Facebook will spend $400M on Watch in the period with half going towards original content. 
    • For Facebook to break even on its spending, every North American daily user would need to spend 20 minutes per day watching about 7 minutes of Watch videos.   
    • Facebook shares are down 0.99%.    
    • Previously: JPMorgan analyst names Netflix, Facebook top internet picks (Dec. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 17 Comments
  • RDFN

    Stephens initiates Redfin at Underweight

    • Stephens initiates Redfin (NASDAQ:RDFN) with an Underweight rating and $17 price target.
    • Analyst John Campbell believes in the current management but says if the team can “turn it upside down” it could be “decades in the making.” 
    • Campbell notes that Redfin’s brokerage business model leaves little room to reign in costs or to grow revenue substantially. 
    • Tailwinds include the company’s large amount of cash with no debt that could lead to acquisitions. The more plentiful headwinds include housing regulations that slow the housing market. 
    • Source: MarketWatch 
    • Redfin shares are up 2.6% to $23.38.   
    • Previously: Redfin shares down 8.5% after Q3 misses, in-line guidance (Nov. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 4 Comments

  • Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Losers: EGBN -9%. ONDK -7%. CIA -7%. MLP -7%. IMH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • MD

    Mednax volatile amidst rumored takeover interest

    • Reuters reports that healthcare network operator Mednax (MD -0.3%) is fielding acquisition interest from several private equity firms, including Carlyle Group.
    • Bank of America is advising.
    • Shares were up 5% intraday before retracing.
    • Update: According to Bloomberg, the company denies the issue.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: AMWD +25%. FMI +22%. CGG-OLD +17%. AMPE +20%. AMBA +15%. AGLE +15%. CLRO +14%. XNET +13%. CASI +12%. MARA +12%.
    • Losers: GCO -20%. UTI -17%. OVID -15%. MTSL -15%. TEUM -14%. ZUMZ -11%. ARCW -11%. YTEN -10%. HMNY -10%. GTIM -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • CC

    Chemours -3% after investor update; North Carolina eyes punishment steps

    • Chemours (CC -2.9%) turns sharply lower after updating its outlook and providing key financial targets for 2020, and unveiling a new capital allocation strategy at its first investor day.
    • CC announces a $500M share repurchase plan through the end of 2020 and raises its quarterly dividend by $0.14/share to $0.17.
    • The company expects to grow adjusted EPS by 15% or more through 2020 on a compounded annual basis from 2017 levels and to increase its 2018 free cash flow to come in at a range of $500M-$600M; adjusted 2018 EBITDA is expected at $1.7B-$1.85B.
    • At the same time, North Carolina's state legislature reportedly is on the verge of punishing the company for its role in contaminating drinking water in the Wilmington area and in residential wells in the vicinity of its Fayetteville plant.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 6 Comments
  • VMW

    Analysts make VMware adjustments after earnings

    • BMO Capital Markets upgrades VMware (NYSE:VMW) from Market Perform to Outperform with a $142 price target.
    • The firm says VMware’s FCF-based valuation remains compelling and that FCF matters more than P/E. 
    • Other action: Drexel Hamilton downgrades VMware from Buy to Hold. 
    • Analyst Brian White says VMware has had excellent execution but finds the valuation now “less compelling” due to “peaking” sales.       
    • VMware shares are up 2.4%.
    • Previously: VMware +2.1% after Q3 beats (update) (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • MLNX

    Longbow upgrades Mellanox Tech

    • Longbow Research upgrades Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) from Neutral to Buy with a $70 price target.
    • Mellanox shares are up 1%.        
    • Previously: Barclays upgrades Mellanox Tech, raises price target (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: AMWD +23%. ANFI +5%.
    • Losers: KBSF -8%. FIZZ -7%. NVFY -7%. OXM -6%. ZX -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM

  • High-yield takes a hit on Flynn report

    • Treasury yields are falling sharply after an ABC reports that former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn will testify someone high in the transition team directed him to contact the Russian ambassador regarding sanctions shortly after the election.
    • High-yield isn't benefitting, however, with spreads widening six basis points since the news hit. HYG -0.7%, JNK -0.7%
    • Previously: Bonds and gold gain, dollar skids on report of Flynn cooperation (Dec. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 5 Comments

  • Bonds and gold gain, dollar skids on report of Flynn cooperation

    • ABC is reporting that former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn will testify that then-President-elect Trump or his team shortly after the election directed him to contact the Russian ambassador to discuss sanctions.
    • Stocks have turned sharply lower, but the rouged-up bond and gold markets are catching a bid. The 10-year Treasury yield has tumbled nine basis points to 2.32%. TLT +1.9%, TBT -3.8%
    • Gold is up 0.75%, and GLD 1.1%.
    • The dollar index (UUP, UDN) is down 0.4%.
    • Previously: Report: Flynn cooperating; stocks head south (Dec. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 13 Comments

  • Report: Flynn cooperating; stocks head south

    • Former National Security Advisor Michael Flynn - in court today to plead guilty to lying to the FBI about his post-election Russian contacts - is prepared to testify the Trump team asked him to contact the Russian ambassador, according to ABC.
    • Flat prior to the news, the major averages have turned lower, led by the Nasdaq's (NASDAQ:QQQ) 1.1% decline. The S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) is down 0.9%, and the Dow (NYSEARCA:DIA) 0.8%.
    • Update at 12:00 ET: Trump layer Ty Cobb releases a statement saying Flynn's plea implicates no one but Flynn.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 381 Comments
  • CRC

    Energy stocks rip higher as OPEC supply cut extension adds to confidence

    • Energy leads the way among S&P sector gainers as WTI crude +2.2% to $58.70/bbl and Brent crude +2.4% to $64.16/bbl after OPEC and Russia agreed to prolong production cuts through the end of 2018.
    • "OPEC and the cooperating countries have created a very high level of confidence that they are standing behind the oil market, that they're going to drive the inventories further down," says SEB Markets chief commodities analyst Bjarne Schieldrop. "They gave a very serious and trustworthy appearance yesterday and that is taking away a lot of the downside in the market."
    • Among today's top gainers in the oil and gas group: CRC +10%, QEP +8%, ESV +8%, SN +8%, SM +7%, NE +7%, QEP +7%, APA +6%, NBR +5%, RRC +4%, WPX +4%.
    • But the global supermajors are lagging: XOM -0.1%, CVX +0.5%, RDS.A +0.2%, BP -0.1%, TOT +0.4%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, DWT, ERX, XOP, SCO, OIH, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, DTO, BGR, XES, USL, FENY, DUG, IYE, GUSH, IEO, DRIP, FIF, DNO, IEZ, PXE, NDP, OLO, RYE, SZO, PXJ, FXN, OLEM, CRAK, DDG, NANR, OILK, WTIU, OILX, WTID, USOI, JHME, ERYY, FTXN, ERGF
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 45 Comments
  • MYL

    FDA OKs Mylan's Herceptin biosimilar; shares up 4%

    • The FDA approves Mylan N.V.'s (MYL +4.2%) Ogivri (trastuzumab-dkst), a biosimilar of Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY +0.1%) breast cancer med Herceptin.
    • Previously: FDA extends action date three months for Mylan's Herceptin biosimilar (Aug. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM

  • Healthcare Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: AMPE +30%. FMI +17%. CASI +13%. AGLE +13%. RIOT +11%.
    • Losers: OVID -10%. SENS -6%. AXSM -5%. PETX -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • MYL

    FDA OKs Mylan's heparin blood thinner; shares ahead 4%

    • The FDA approves Mylan N.V.'s (MYL +4.1%) marketing application for Heparin Sodium Injection USP in four strengths, all in multi-dose vials.
    • Heparin is a traditional anticoagulant used by heart disease and cardiovascular disease patients as well as in blood transfusions and dialysis.
    • According to IQVIA, the U.S. market is ~$185M.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • BKNG

    Argus cools on Priceline

    • Argus downgrades Priceline Group (PCLN -0.5%) to Hold from Buy after factoring in "weak" guidance from the online travel giant and concerns over spending.
    • "Priceline has spent heavily to develop its vacation rental business and saw significantly higher compensation costs in the third quarter. It will also face higher costs as it expands television advertising for Booking.com to 30 countries from a current 12," warns analyst John Staszak.
    • "We believe that the expanded advertising points to greater industry competition, and expect the additional compensation, business development, and advertising costs to pressure earnings in the coming quarters," he adds.
    • Looking further down the road, Argus keeps a long term Buy rating in place on Priceline.
    • Source: Analyst note
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 4 Comments
  • AMZN

    Wells Fargo raises Amazon price target to new Street high

    • Wells Fargo raises its Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) price target from $1,430 to $1,525, a new Street high, and maintains its Overweight rating.
    • Analyst Ken Sena cites the numerous Amazon Web Services announcements during this week’s re: Invent conference, which featured an AI and machine learning slant.
    • Sena singled out SageMaker as a “game-changer” for the AI and ML market and the product inspired him to increase the 2019 sales estimate for AWS by 3% to $31.3B.
    • Amazon shares are down 0.41%.  
    • Previously: Amazon Web Services announces new AI products (Nov. 29)
    • Previously: Analysts raise Amazon price targets to new Street high (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 21 Comments
  • DHCP

    Walter Investment files prepackaged bankruptcy

    • The company late last night announced the filing of a voluntary Chapter 11 petition in federal bankruptcy court.
    • The prepackaged plan is seen reducing outstanding debt by about $800M by the end of next year.
    • WAC +33.9% to $0.491
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM | 8 Comments
  • FIVE

    Red-hot retail read from Five Below

    • Another strong read for the retail sector arrived last night when Five Below (FIVE +1.5%) reported Q3 numbers ahead of estimates.
    • Standing out was Five Below's impressive 8.5% gain in comparable sales during the quarter.
    • Guidance from Five Below was also strong. The retailer expects Q4 revenue of $491M to $503M vs. $484M consensus and EPS of $1.09 to $1.16 vs. $1.08 consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • PRKR

    German court doesn't require ParkerVision bond, requests more information

    • ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR) announces that a German court rejected bond requests from Apple and certain subsidiaries.
    • The court disagreed with claims that ParkerVision GmbH should have to post a bond as required by non-German entities.
    • The Munich court also invited ParkerVision GmbH to clarify certain elements of its patent infringement case against Apple before the court finalizes its decision.   
    • “We welcome the court’s request for additional information, as we believe further clarification will only strengthen our infringement position and enable the court to reach a swift decision.  We are working with German counsel to expedite the schedule for these next steps and anticipate that the court will continue to move at the same rapid pace that it has thus far,” says ParkerVision CEO Jeffrey Parker.
    • ParkerVision shares are down 1.5% premarket.    
    • Previously: ParkerVision misses by $0.01 (Nov. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 6 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • MARA +18% on announcement of launch of Bitcoin futures.
    • UQM +18% on signing a Joint Venture Agreement with China National Heavy Duty Truck Group Co. and Sinotruk Global Village Investment Limited.
    • GLBS +13%.
    • DPW +12%.
    • RIOT +10% on announcement of launch of Bitcoin futures.
    • CPL +10%.
    • SRAX +9% on announcement of launch of Bitcoin futures.
    • GROW +8% on announcement of launch of Bitcoin futures.
    • AMBA +7% on Q3 earnings.
    • APRN +6% on appointment of new CEO.
    • NTNX +6% on Q1 earnings.
    • GCAP +6% on Bitcoin launch.
    • PLUG +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • NVCR

    Reimbursement for Novocure's Optune OK'd in Japan; shares up 4% premarket

    • Novocure (NASDAQ:NVCR) is up 4% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that the Japanese Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare has approved reimbursement for Optune for the treatment of newly diagnosed glioblastoma, a fast-growing brain tumor that affects ~1,500 Japanese each year.
    • Optune is a non-invasive device that creates alternating "wave-like" electric fields called Tumor Treating Fields (TTFields). It delivers its therapy to brain tumors through four transducer arrays placed on the scalp.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • GCO -19% on Q3 earnings.
    • ULTA -7% on Q3 earnings.
    • YRD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • APRN

    Blue Apron rallies after CEO move

    • Blue Apron (NYSE:APRN) jumps in premarket trading after the company's appointment of a new CEO is well received.
    • "We have known Dickerson for almost eight years and believe that his focus on operational discipline will drive better financial results," writes KeyBanc analyst Edward Yruma in a new note to clients.
    • Investors may also have their eyes on the reaffirmed second half guidance from the company that implies a solid Q4 to date, observes Needham analyst Kerry Rice.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Blue Apron taps CFO for CEO position (Nov. 30)
    • APRN +7.02% premarket to $3.20.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 3 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez in retreat after margins miss

    • Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) trades lower after Q3 margin results disappointed.
    • The retailer reported a gross margin rate of 33.9% of sales vs. 34.6% consensus and 34.4% a year ago. EPS came in right at estimates, while revenue beat by more than $3M.
    • "We are confident that our merchandise strategies, integrated sales channels and best in class sales team have Zumiez well positioned to deliver strong holiday results and achieve meaningful earnings growth in the fourth quarter," says CEO Rck Brooks.
    • Zumiez expects holiday quarter sales of $291M to $297M and EPS of $0.78 to $0.84 vs. $0.79 consensus.
    • Previously: Zumiez EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 30)
    • ZUMZ -5.03% premarket to $20.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • GCAP

    Gain Capital up nearly 5% on Bitcoin launch

    • The company announces the launch of Bitcoin trading on City Index platform for U.K. users. It's expected to be rolled out globally over the coming quarter.
    • GCAP +4.6% premarket
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • CMI

    Cummins downgraded, AGCO upgraded at Goldman in move to ag sector

    • Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -1.5% premarket as Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy with a $180 price target, trimmed from $192.
    • At the same time, the firm upgrades AGCO (NYSE:AGCO) to Conviction Buy from Neutral with a $90 target, up from $77.
    • Goldman analyst Jerry Revich says he prefers exposure to agriculture over trucks to position for the next leg of the recovery in the machinery sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • AVGO

    Bloomberg: Broadcom won't increase Qualcomm offer until next year

    • Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) won’t increase its offer for Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) ahead of next week’s proposal to replace the board of directors with its own nominees, according to Bloomberg sources.
    • Broadcom has to nominate directors before the December 8 deadline.
    • The sources say Broadcom doesn’t plan to increase its offer until closer to Qualcomm’s March board meeting. 
    • Qualcomm’s current board rejected Broadcom’s offer of $70 per share. Qualcomm shareholders reportedly want at least $10 more per share. 
    • Broadcom likely delayed the offer increase to have a chance to convince shareholders to agree to a friendly acquisition. 
    • Broadcom is also waiting to see what happens to Qualcomm’s acquisition of NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI), which is stuck in regulatory delays. The NXP deal could strengthen Qualcomm’s position and complication Broadcom’s acquisition. 
    • Qualcomm shares are down 1.6% premarket. 
    • Previously: CNBC: Broadcom finalizing nominees for Qualcomm board (update) (Nov. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 130 Comments
  • HMNY

    Helios and Matheson release MoviePass financials

    • Helios and Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) releases MoviePass financial information in a new regulatory filing.
    • For the nine months ending September 30, MoviePass reported nearly $5M in subscription revenues, $5.3M in operating expenses, and a $9.9M loss from operations.
    • Cash flow from operating activities was -$12M, and MoviePass ended the period with $3.3M in net cash.
